hook.text: Scotland has its own parliament inside the United Kingdom. Britain devolved power without going federal.

buildup.text: Devolution transfers power from the central government to regions without changing the constitution.

discovery.text: Spain devolved power to Catalonia. But Catalonia's independence push tested the arrangement's limits.

twist.text: Devolution can satisfy regional demands or inflame them. Autonomy sometimes fuels separatism.

climax.text: It's a balancing act. Give too little and regions resent you. Give too much and the nation fragments.

punchline.text: Devolution shares power without splitting the state. Usually.

quiz.question: What is devolution?
options: Transferring power from central to regional government without constitutional change
A complete breakup of a country into independent states
Merging multiple countries into one federation
